summary: Mount Takahe is a massive shield volcano in Antarctica, standing at 3,460 meters (11,350 feet) tall. It is covered in snow, ice, and glaciers and has a caldera, or large depression, at its summit. This volcano is part of a group of 19 volcanoes in the West Antarctic Rift System. Mount Takahe has been active for 2.5 million years, with its last eruption occurring around 7,600 years ago. Explosive eruptions from this volcano have left tephra layers in nearby ice cores, and it may have even formed an ozone hole over Antarctica during a major eruption 17,700 years ago.
title: Mount Takahe
